cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 27.64mm over 15.9 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 27.0mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked first from our records.  The precipitation lasted 2.0 hours and dumped 7.99mm in total.

storm.status: On 23 November 2024, rainfall persisted for 23.2 hours, accumulating 24.56mm at falling at 6.4mm per hour at times.
Active storm detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, counting 9 days starting August 26, 2025, ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on July 18, 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (209°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 Oct 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.3 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1702 m), light levels (up 2609 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 116.1m lower than yesterday, 599.2m lower than the past week, 1702.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 950.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Periods of rain anticipated, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
